EVGD 200.courseDesc: This course is an introduction to the Environmental Graphic Design specialty including wayfinding systems, architectural graphics, signage, exhibit design, and mapped and themed environments.
EVGD 200.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
EVGD 200.prereqs: VSCM 230 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 240 [Min Grade D]

EVGD 220.courseDesc: This course explores the discipline of wayfinding in an urban environment through the use of visual clues and directional hierarchy, including typography, symbols, and color.
EVGD 220.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

EVGD 320.courseDesc: This exploration of exhibit design focuses on communicating a narrative visually through the design of space, graphics, objects, and interactivity.
EVGD 320.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
EVGD 320.prereqs: VSCM 230 [Min Grade D] and VSCM 240 [Min Grade D] and EVGD 200 [Min Grade D]

EVGD 421.courseDesc: This course explores the marketing power of a branded identity when it is visually and spatially applied to a retail environment.
EVGD 421.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

EVGD I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
EVGD I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
EVGD I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
